item.title: Thrust Management System (Including Autothrottle System) – Autothrottle Servo

numlitem.para: Approach minimums do not require use of autothrottles.
EICAS display of Thrust Management Computers computations are operative.

note.para: After maintenance procedures are accomplished, an electrical interruption may cause TMC calculated EICAS parameters to blank. If this occurs, crew may accomplish the following steps to restore the displays:

numlitem.para: Uncollar the TMC SERVO circuit breaker (F16) on (P11) panel.
Momentarily close and then open the TMC SERVO circuit breaker.
Downgrade aircraft category dispatch status to CAT 1.

placard.para: Placard the Autothrottle Servo “INOP” and enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.para: Deferral of this item requires downgrading to the status indicated in the A/C STATUS DISPATCH column below.

numlitem.para: Open and Collar TMC Servo Circuit Breaker (F16) on (P11) panel.
Set Autothrottle Arm switch to OFF.

note.para: When the Autothrottle System is deactivated by opening the TMC SERVO circuit breaker, the Thrust Management Computer and associated EICAS displays will operate normally.
An electrical power interruption may cause TMC calculated EICAS parameters to blank. Momentarily closing and then opening the TMC SERVO circuit breaker will restore the displays.
